experiences.title: Robotics Engineer
experiences.subtitle: Prof. John Reid & Prof. Sunoj Shajahan, UIUC
workDescription: Leading a team of 5 to develop Model Predictive Controller (MPC) and vision-based lane-following navigation capabilities on the AMIGA platform, utilizing the OAK depth camera to enable autonomous driving and real-time obstacle detection.

Designing and developing a standalone vision-based weeding mechanism using ROS 2, incorporating Jetson Orin, a lead screw mechanism, and pneumatic air cylinders for precise identification and removal of weeds in Horseradish agricultural fields.

experiences.title: Graduate Student Researcher
experiences.subtitle: Prof. John Reid & Prof. Sunoj Shajahan, UIUC
workDescription: Worked under Prof. John Reid & Prof. Sunoj Shajahan as a Graduate Student developing the autonomous navigation capabilities for the AMIGA robot along with precise mechanical weeding mechanism to autonomously remove weeds in the Horseradish fields.

experiences.title: Robotics Engineer
experiences.subtitle: Kohler Co.
workDescription: Explored LiDAR, point clouds, and depth cameras for defect detection, ultimately utilizing Basler machine vision cameras to develop a real-time vision-based inspection system, improving defect identification speed, accuracy, & consistency in Kohler’s manufacturing process.

Implemented computer vision techniques and leveraged GANs to create synthetic datasets for hard-to-detect glaze defects in ceramics, building a proof of concept (PoC) for integrating machine learning models into existing systems, improving quality control and efficiency.

experiences.title: Research Project
experiences.subtitle: Prof. Katie Driggs Campbell, Human-Centered Autonomy Lab, UIUC
workDescription: Conducted a series of controlled experiments inspired by the paper ”Towards Robotics that Influence Humans over Long-Term Interaction”, focusing on the application & testing of interaction scenarios using the GEM e4 vehicle.
Implemented pedestrian detection & tracking using YOLO object detection models through the GEMStack technology developed by AutonomouStuff on GEM e4 vehicle.

experiences.title: Robotics R&D Intern
experiences.subtitle: Rucha Yantra LLP
workDescription: Aided in the development of an automated system for high-precision manufacturing, utilizing computer vision to accurately locate critical points on cylindrical units for robotic automation. This initiative helped enhance operational accuracy and safety by reducing human interaction with high-pressure helium gas cylinders.

Collaborated on enhancing autonomous operations by integrating computer vision algorithms that dynamically adjusted robotic mechanisms in real-time, effectively improving production efficiency through reduced processing times.

Contributed to improve the vision based path following for Automated Guided Vehicles (AGV's), automating material handling in warehouse settings and effectively reducing labor demands wile improving workflow efficiancy.

Gained extensive hands-on experience with ROS, Linux, and OpenCV. Collaborated closely with the R&D team to troubleshoot, optimize, and advance the integration of sophisticated sensors and camera systems into industrial automation projects.

experiences.title: Robotics Intern
experiences.subtitle: Turquoise Automation
workDescription: Developed a robotic prototype, designed to transport heavy materials within warehouse environments to improve operational efficiency and safety.
Worked with sensors and motor controllers integrating them to the robot to facilitate obstacle detection and navigation, supporting effective material handling in dynamic settings.
Utilized ArUco marker detection techniques for pose estimation to enable the robot to ascertain its precise location and orientation within the warehouse.

Implemented control algorithms using Python on platforms like Raspberry Pi and NVIDIA Jetson, which controlled servo motors and motor drivers, enhancing the robot’s navigation and load management abilities.

experiences.title: Embedded Systems Intern
experiences.subtitle: UFF
workDescription: Led a small team of two in designing and developing a smart portable billing device aimed at improving operational efficiency in restaurants.

Developed a compact billing solution using an ESP32 microcontroller and IoT technologies, featuring a thermal printer for quick receipt issuance. The device incorporated Python-based enhancements to the user interface, supporting robust transaction handling, real-time data synchronization, and remote management capabilities. These improvements facilitated quicker and more accurate transactions in restaurant settings.
The deployment of the smart billing device reduced the reliance on manual order processing, cutting down customer wait times for ordering by over 75% and making the dining experience more efficient.
